label: NEXTANALYSISDATE
description: This field contains the date the next analysis is to be generated.

label: FINALANALYSISDATE
description: The system generates a final escrow disclosure for all escrowed loans where this date (final analysis date) falls within the date range entered at the Analysis Selection prompt, when you run a (2) Final Escrow Disclosure analysis type.

label: PRIORANALYSISSOURCE
description: This field indicates whether there is a previous analysis available.

label: INITIALDISCLTHIRD
description: This field indicates whether a third party has already provided the Initial Escrow Disclosure statement to the member.

label: DATEINITDISCLNEED
description: This field is used by the Escrow Reports batch program to determine when to create an Initial Escrow Disclosure statement and report for this escrow account.

label: ACTUALINITIALDISCL
description: This field stores the date the initial escrow disclosure was created to be provided to the member.

label: DATEANALYSISCALC
description: This field stores the date the last escrow analysis was calculated with the results in the Escrow Analysis record.

label: LASTANALYSISPROCESSED
description: This field indicates the most recent analysis process generated on an escrowed loan.

label: CURRENTPAYMENTFREQ
description: This field contains the Payment Frequency field value copied from the Loan record when the escrow analysis was performed.

label: CURRENTDUEDAY1
description: During escrow analysis, the value in the Due Day 1 field in the Loan record is copied to this field. This field contains the first payment due date for semi-monthly payment loans or the day of the month on which all loan payments are due for annual, semi-annual, quarterly, or monthly loans.

label: CURRENTDUEDAY2
description: During escrow analysis, the value in the Due Day 2 field in the Loan record is copied to this field. This field is not used for annual, semi-annual, quarterly, monthly, or biweekly loans.

label: NEXTPAYMENTDUEDATE
description: This field stores the next payment due date for the loan when the escrow analysis was performed. This value is copied from the Loan record Due Date field.

label: FORECASTBEGSTMTBAL
description: This field is calculated during the analysis and is typically used as the starting balance in the Estimate of Activity trial balance section. This trial balance is also part of the member escrow analysis statement.

label: EXPECTEDBEGSTMTBAL
description: This field is calculated during the analysis and is used as the starting balance in the Adj Trial Balance section. T

label: SHORTAGE
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, any calculated shortage is stored in this field.

label: DEFICIENCY
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, any deficiency is stored in this field.

label: OVERAGE
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, any calculated overage amount is stored in this field.

label: OVERAGEREFUNDED
description: The value in this field represents the amount of any escrowed funds that are being refunded to the borrower as a result of the escrow account analysis.

label: CUSHION
description: This is the amount of cushion that was used in the latest escrow analysis. It is a total of all required cushions for the escrow types represented in the Loan Escrow records under the Loan record.

label: ACTIONSHORTAGE
description: Based on the Escrow Analysis parameter settings and the actual analysis of the escrow account, this field contains the code that links to verbiage describing the action taken by the credit union relating to the shortage.

label: ACTIONDEFICIENCY
description: Based on the Escrow Analysis parameter settings and the actual analysis of the escrow account, this field contains the code that links to verbiage describing the action taken by the credit union relating to the deficiency.

label: ANALYSISTHRUDATE
description: This field stores the date that the analysis is projected through. It determines the last month that is reflected in the Projections for Coming Year section of the member analysis statement, as well as in the three trial balances that are calculated as part of the analysis.

label: CURRENTPAYMENT
description: This field stores the current total escrow payment for the loan.

label: CURRENTBALANCE
description: This field contains the balance in the escrow share account that is identified in the Loan record Escrow ID field.

label: RECORDCHANGEDATE
description: The system stores the system date in this field when you create, change, or save this record if the change is made from this record.

label: REQUIREDNEWPAYMENT
description: This field reflects the calculated escrow payment amount before adding an amount to cover any shortage or deficiency. It represents the total estimated escrow disbursement divided by 12 months if the payments are payable monthly, and divided by 24 months if the payments are payable semi-monthly.

label: AMTCOVERSHORTAGE
description: This field contains the amount added to the Required New Escrow Payment field to cover any shortage spread over the number of months specified in the Escrow Analysis parameters. This is the amount per escrow payment needed to cover the shortage.

label: AMTCOVERDEFICIENCY
description: This field contains the amount added to the Required New Escrow Payment field to cover any deficiency spread over the number of months specified at the Escrow Analysis parameters. This is the amount per escrow payment needed to cover the deficiency.

label: PMTREDUCEDOVERAGE
description: When an overage does not meet the refund threshold, the amount of the overage is divided by 12 if the loan payments are monthly and divided by 24 if the loan payments are semi-monthly; the resulting value is stored in this field. This amount is used to reduce each escrow payment.

label: AMTADDEDROUNDING
description: This is the amount added, if any, to round the entire loan payment (principal, interest, and escrow amount) to an even dollar amount.

label: NEWESCROWPAYMENT:1
description: The New Escrow Payment 1 field stores a history of escrow payment amount changes resulting from the latest escrow analysis run by selecting either (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements at the Analysis Method prompt.

label: NEWESCROWPAYMENT:2
description: The New Escrow Payment 1 field stores a history of escrow payment amount changes resulting from the latest escrow analysis run by selecting either (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements at the Analysis Method prompt.

label: NEWPAYMENTDATE:1
description: This field contains the date that the New Escrow Payment 1 field becomes effective. When running an analysis, you must respond to the Payment Effective Date prompt, which determines the value in this field.

label: NEWPAYMENTDATE:2
description: This field contains the date that the New Escrow Payment 1 field becomes effective. When running an analysis, you must respond to the Payment Effective Date prompt, which determines the value in this field.

label: CHANGEESCROWPMT
description: This field contains the net change in the escrow payment due to the latest escrow analysis.

label: PREVANALYSISDATE
description: When an analysis is completed using the (1) New Period Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system takes the value from the Next Analysis Date field and moves it to this field.

label: PREVDATEANALYCALC
description: This field stores the date the previous escrow analysis was calculated.

label: PREVPAYMENTFREQ
description: This field contains the Payment Frequency field value copied from the Loan record at the time the previous escrow analysis was performed. When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the payment frequency in the Current Payment Frequency field to this field.

label: PREVDUEDAY1
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Current Due Day 1 field to this field.

label: PREVDUEDAY2
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Current Due Day 2 field to this field.

label: PREVPAYMENTDUEDATE
description: This field displays the next payment due date for the loan at the time the previous escrow analysis was performed.

label: PREVFCASTBEGSTMTBL
description: The value in this field is used as the Starting Balance in the Estimate of Activity trial balance that is created as part of the escrow analysis process. This trial balance is part of the member escrow analysis statement.

label: PREVEXPBEGSTMTBL
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Expected Beg Statement Bal field to this field.

label: PREVSHORTAGE
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Shortage field to this field.

label: PREVDEFICIENCY
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Deficiency field to this field.

label: PREVOVERAGE
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Overage field to this field.

label: PREVOVERAGEREFUNDED
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Overage Refunded field to this field.

label: PREVCUSHION
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Cushion field to this field.

label: PREVACTIONSHORTAGE
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Action Taken for Shortage field to this field.

label: PREVACTIONDEFIC
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Action Taken for Deficiency field to this field.

label: PREVANALYTHRUDATE
description: This field stores the date the previous escrow analysis was calculated through.

label: PREVPAYMENT
description: This is the total escrow payment for the loan based on a previous escrow analysis. When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Current Escrow Payment Amount field to this field.

label: PREVBALANCE
description: This field equals the balance in the escrow share account that is identified in the Loan record Escrow ID field at the time of a previous analysis.

label: PREVREQUIREDPMT
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Required New Escrow Payment field to this field.

label: PREVAMTCOVERSHORT
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Amt Added to Cover Shortage field to this field.

label: PREVAMTCOVERDEF
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Amt Added to Cover Deficiency field to this field.

label: PREVPMTREDUCEDOVER
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Payment Reduced for Overage field to this field.

label: PREVAMTADDEDROUND
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Amt Added for Rounding field to this field.

label: PREVNEWESCROWPMT:1
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the New Escrow Payment 1 field to the Prev New Escrow Payment 1 field. Likewise, the system moves the amount in the New Escrow Payment 2 field to the Prev New Escrow Payment 2 field.

label: PREVNEWESCROWPMT:2
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the New Escrow Payment 1 field to the Prev New Escrow Payment 1 field. Likewise, the system moves the amount in the New Escrow Payment 2 field to the Prev New Escrow Payment 2 field.

label: PREVNEWPMTDATE:1
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the New Escrow Payment Date 1 field to the Prev New Escrow Pmt Date 1 field. Likewise, the system moves the amount in the New Escrow Payment Date 2 field to the Prev New Escrow Pmt Date 2 field.

label: PREVNEWPMTDATE:2
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the New Escrow Payment Date 1 field to the Prev New Escrow Pmt Date 1 field. Likewise, the system moves the amount in the New Escrow Payment Date 2 field to the Prev New Escrow Pmt Date 2 field.

label: PREVCHGESCROWPMT
description: When an analysis is completed using either the (1) New Period Analysis Statements or (2) Replacement Analysis Statements option in the Escrow Reports batch program, the system moves the value in the Change in Escrow Payment field to this field.

label: CLOSINGREQUEST
description: This field tracks the entity that requested to close the escrow account and to generate the Escrow Closing Notice.

label: REMAINOPENOPTION
description: This field specifies whether the credit union offers members the option to keep their escrow account open.

label: NOTICEDATE
description: This field stores the date when the Escrow Reports batch program generates the Escrow Closing Notice.

label: NOTICECLOSINGDATE
description: This field specifies the date that the credit union can close the escrow account.

label: NOTICECLOSINGFEE
description: This field stores the fee amount in the Escrow Closing Fee Amount prompt in the Escrow Reports batch program.

label: LOCATOR
description: The system stores a unique number within each member account in this field that can be used as a unique identification of this record.
